intro: Ctenodon oroboides, commonly known as the mountain ctenodon, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves adapted to its cool, arid environment. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas with limited rainfall. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
